snippet: Officials from 17 euro zone nations reached a tentative agreement on the bailout terms, including releasing 30 billion euros, or $37 billion, by the end of the month.
abstract: Officials from 17 euro zone nations reach a tentative agreement on the bailout terms for Spain's troubled banks, including releasing 30 billion euros, or $37 billion, by the end of July.

byline.original: By PAUL GEITNER and STEPHEN CASTLE
byline.contributor: Paul Geitner reported from Brussels and Stephen Castle from London. Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: Officials from 17 euro zone nations reached a tentative agreement on the bailout terms, including releasing 30 billion euros, or $37 billion, by the end of the month.

headline.main: European Finance Ministers Agree to Speed Up Bailout of Spanish Banks
headline.print_headline: European Finance Ministers Agree to Speed Up Bailout of Spanish Banks
